text:
I do, but they're not the same. There's enough different about them that each of
the releases for Safe OS for 21H2 and 22H2 are significantly different sizes.
Microsoft are the ones that wrote the script and released the update
specifically to exclude 2004/20H1 and 2009/20H2. I'm just pointing out what it
says in the actual release information. Safe OS updates for 2004 aren't listed
in the catalog either:
https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.catalog.update.microsoft.com%2FSearch.aspx%3Fq%3DSafe%2520OS&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C1521adb1e9f742c3151408dc17406568%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638410812545890083%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=coQ%2FjRNR3XjPSaAZzHsXUpkG2QjcDl0YkJhXRFTgvMY%3D&reserved=0
It's possible that the 21H2 or 22H2 updates will work, but each of them are
different sizes so I wouldn't trust it. -S
Link: None

metadata.topic: Re: KB5034957: Updating the WinRE partition on deployed devices to address security vulnerabilities in CVE-2024-20666
